Pre-Game Insights: Experts predicted India as the favorites given their home advantage
India head into the clash third on the World Cup standings with four points and a net run-rate of 1.5, while Pakistan are in fourth also with four points and a net run-rate of 0.927
The inclusion of Gill would mean stand-in opener Ishan Kishan misses out following a handy knock of 47 in the eight-wicket win over Afghanistan

It's hard to see Pakistan changing a winning formula with Mohammed Rizwan and Abdullah Shafique both averaging above 100 with the bat for the tournament, while Hasan Ali has the equal third-most wickets for the World Cup so far with six alongside Indian counterpart Jasprit Bumrah
Miscellaneous Highlights: The recently redeveloped Narendra Modi Stadium is the biggest cricket ground in the world with a capacity of 130,000, and it's expected at least 100,000 of those will be filled on Saturday night
The forecast in Ahmedabad on Saturday in'sunny and very warm' with a top of 36C and humidity reaching 57 per cent. The evening dew point is 21C
Batting first or second doesn't seem to matter too much at Narendra Modi Stadium with setting and chasing teams each winning five of the past 10 matches at the venue
